com.googlecode.biscotti.collect
Interface SortedList<E>

Type Parameters:
E - the type of elements held in this list
All Superinterfaces:
Collection<E>, Iterable<E>, List<E>, SortedCollection<E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ForwardingSortedList, TreeList
public interface SortedList<E>
extends SortedCollection<E>, List<E>

A List that further provides a total ordering on its elements. This interface is the List analog of SortedSet. The elements are ordered using their natural ordering, or by an explicit Comparator provided at creation time.

To take advantage of the specified ordering additional headList(E), subList(E, E), tailList(E) operations are provided.

Author:
Zhenya Leonov

Method Detail

headList

SortedList<E> headList(E toElement)
Returns a view of the portion of this list whose elements are strictly less than toElement. This implies that if the list contains duplicate elements, none of the elements which are equal to toElement, will be included in the returned list. The returned list is backed by this list, so changes in the returned list are reflected in this list.

Attempts to insert an element outside the specified range will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
toElement - high endpoint (exclusive) of the returned list
Returns:
a view of the portion of this list whose elements are strictly less than toElement
Throws:
ClassCastException - if toElement is not comparable to the elements in this list
NullPointerException - if toElement is null and this list does not permit null elements

subList

SortedList<E> subList(E fromElement,
                      E toElement)
Returns a view of the portion of this list whose elements range from fromElement, inclusive, to toElement, exclusive. This implies that if the list contains duplicate elements, all of the elements which are equal to fromElement and none of the elements which are equal to toElement, will be included in the returned list. (If fromElement and toElement are equal, the returned list is empty.) The returned list is backed by this list, so changes in the returned list are reflected in this list.

Attempts to insert an element outside the specified range will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
fromElement - low endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
toElement - high endpoint (exclusive) of the returned list
Returns:
a view of the portion of this list whose elements range from fromElement, inclusive, to toElement, exclusive
Throws:
ClassCastException - if fromElement or toElement is not comparable to the elements in this list
NullPointerException - if fromElement or toElement is null and this list does not permit null elements
IllegalArgumentException - if fromElement is greater than toElement

subList

SortedList<E> subList(int fromIndex,
                      int toIndex)
Returns a view of the portion of this list between the specified fromIndex, inclusive, and toIndex, exclusive. (If fromIndex and toIndex are equal, the returned list is empty.) The returned list is backed by this list, so non-structural changes in the returned list are reflected in this list, and vice-versa. The returned list supports all of the optional list operations supported by this list.

This method eliminates the need for explicit range operations (of the sort that commonly exist for arrays). Any operation that expects a list can be used as a range operation by passing a subList view instead of a whole list. For example, the following idiom removes a range of elements from a list: 

      list.subList(from, to).clear();
Similar idioms may be constructed for indexOf and lastIndexOf, and all of the algorithms in the Collections class can be applied to a subList.

The semantics of the list returned by this method become undefined if the backing list (i.e., this list) is structurally modified in any way other than via the returned list. (Structural modifications are those that change the size of this list, or otherwise perturb it in such a fashion that iterations in progress may yield incorrect results.)

Attempts to insert an element outside the specified range will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

Specified by:
subList in interface List<E>
Parameters:
fromIndex - low endpoint (inclusive) of the subList
toIndex - high endpoint (exclusive) of the subList
Returns:
a view of the specified range within this list

tailList

SortedList<E> tailList(E fromElement)
Returns a view of the portion of this list whose elements are greater than or equal to fromElement. This implies that if the list contains duplicate elements, all of the elements which are equal to fromElement, will be included in the returned list. The returned list is backed by this list, so changes in the returned list are reflected in this list.

Attempts to insert an element outside the specified range will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
fromElement - low endpoint (inclusive) of the returned list
Returns:
a view of the portion of this list whose elements are greater than or equal to fromElement
Throws:
ClassCastException - if fromElement is not comparable to the elements in this list
NullPointerException - if fromElement is null and this list does not permit null elements
